title: In a Global First, Turkcell Incorporates Audio Description into Its Mobile App for the Visually Imparied
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/22/2015 @ 6:36 AM Companies mentioned in this article: Turkcell 
ISTANBUL -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Turkcell (NYSE:TKC) (BIST:TCELL) has launched a new feature on its award-winning “My Dream Partner” service for the visually impaired. Audio description feature, which will be offered on a mobile app for the first time in the world, will allow the subscribers of “My Dream Partner” service to enjoy watching movies in movie theaters. This Smart News Release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20151022005894/en/ Ali Sunal and Hatice Sendil, the lead actors of the movie "Kiss of Life" - a BKM production, joined the gala where Turkcell launched world's first audio description on a mobile app. (Photo: Business Wire) 
The audio description feature was launched during the special gala of the Turkish film “Hayat Opucugu – Kiss of Life”. The service, which complements visually impaired movie-goers’ experience through detailed description of non-dialogue scenes, will be available in all Turkish movie-theaters. 
Turkcell worked with the Young Guru Academy (YGA) and Turkey’s “Audio Description Association” SEBEDER to develop the product. 
“We constantly look for ways in which technology can improve the lives of our customers with disabilities – and in that process, we always get a first-hand perspective on what their needs are. We realized that being able to go to the movies with their loved ones and having a full experience of the movie mattered to our visually-impaired customers. Working with the Young Guru Academy, we managed to incorporate the audio description feature into our “Dream Partner” service in 6 months.” said Burak Sevilengul, Chief Marketing Officer of Turkcell . “We now call on all producers to make the best use of this technology to make sure that everyone in a movie theater can enjoy watching movies to a fuller extent.” 
Audio description works in Turkcell’s “My Dream Partner” mobile application. Movie-goers can choose the “cinema” category, select the movie and start listening to the sychronized audio description with their earphones. The product was tested by Turkcell’s and Young Guru Academy’s visually-impaired employees. The feature is available free-of-charge and open to customers of all operators who subscribe to My Dream Partner. 
“My Dream Partner”, a free service for the visually-impaired, provides access to current news, more than 70 columnists’ daily columns, hundreds of thousands of audio-books, training programs and practical information including weather and exchange rates. In the Global Mobile Awards 2014, the service was chosen as the “Best Mobile Service for Accessibility or Ease-of-use” in the category of "Social and Economic Development" by the GSMA. 
ABOUT TURKCELL : Turkcell is an integrated communication and technology services player in Turkey. Turkcell Group has approximately 67.9 million mobile subscribers in nine countries and over 1.3 million fixed subscribers in Turkey as of June 30, 2015. Turkcell was one of the first among the global operators to have implemented HSPA+. It has announced two new HSPA+ Technologies on its 3G network to meet rising data usage. Having successfully integrated 3C-HSDPA and DC-HSUPA Technologies, it became the first mobile operator in the world to enable peak speed of 63.3 Mbps downlink while also enabled an 11.5 Mbps uplink on a 3G network. Turkcell is the first telecom operator to offer households fiber broadband connection at speeds of up to 1,000 Mbps in Turkey. As of June 2015, Turkcell’s population coverage is at 99.85% in 2G and 92.06% in 3G. Turkcell Group reported a TRY3.1 billion (US$1.2 billion) revenue with total assets of TRY20.7 billion (US$7.7billion) as of June 30, 2015. It has been listed on the NYSE and the BIST since July 2000, and is the only NYSE-listed company in Turkey. Read more at www.turkcell.com.tr
